newsitem.title: BELGIUM: SOCCER-BELGIAN STRIKER FACES TRIAL FOR HEAD-BUTTING NURSE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BELGIAN STRIKER FACES TRIAL FOR HEAD-BUTTING NURSE.

text.p: A Belgian court ruled on Monday that soccer international Gilles De Bilde must stand trial for assault after head-butting one male nurse and punching another last year.
"He has been referred to the correctional court," Brussels public prosecutor's office spokesman Jos Colpin told Reuters. He said any appeal was likely to be rejected.

Anderlecht striker De Bilde, who won the 1994 award for best Belgian league player, attacked the nurses when he was denied access to a hospital room where his father was being treated for a heart attack in August 1995.
He also kicked the ambulance on its arrival at his father's home because he thought it took too long to get there.
One of the nurses was temporarily unable to work after the attack, Colpin said
